name: Titu
desc: Storyteller of the Children of Echoes and a guard at the sentry post. The real Titu lived about 500 years ago, and then his image was used by Waxaklahun Ubah Kan.

customize.name: Ochkanatlan
customize.desc: In order to pursue the great dream in the morning mist and sea of clouds, the warriors who soared the skies never rested for a moment.

customize.text: After the , Titu and a group of people went to Ochkanatlan to look for the legendary Jade of Return, which could destroy the Abyss. Of the entire group, only one person survived, and Titu himself died on the ship "Tonatiuh."

customize.name: Manqu
customize.desc: A researcher for the Saurian Relics Association, who is responsible for scholarly inquiries into certain tribal customs. The real Manqu was a craftsman who lived a thousand years ago and died during the overthrow of the tyrant Och-Kan. Now, Manqu is a phlogiston projection of Waxaklahun Ubah Kan.

customize.text: Titu calls Manqu his brother. In reality, Manqu is a phlogiston projection of Waxaklahun Ubah Kan.

customize.name: Waxaklahun Ubah Kan
customize.desc: The wisest among dragons, who stole the flame from his kind and taught people how to use it. He wanted to create a ruler of the dragon and human worlds. His true name is Kukulkan.

customize.text: After Titu's death on "Tonatiuh," Waxaklahun Ubah Kan used his image for his own purposes. "Titu" had several past lives and memories of the past lives, but he was not in any of them. "Titu's" life was like a dream in which he could not control his body. When the Sage of the Stolen Flame dissolved, "Titu" awoke from his sleep and heard the call of the Lord of the Night.

customize.name: Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City
